items.title: How many?
items.comment: Used to ask about a small number, such as age or quantity.

items.title: How old are you? (children)
items.comment: Used to ask someone's age, typically for children or young people.

items.title: How old are you? (adults)
items.comment: Used to ask someone's age, commonly for adults.

items.title: How many siblings do you have?
How many siblings do you have?
items.pinyin: nǐ yǒu jǐ gè xiōngdì jiěmèi?
items.pronounce: nee yoh jee guh syong-dee jyeh-may?
items.comment: Used to ask about the number of siblings someone has.

items.text: 我有两个兄弟，一个姐妹。
items.title: I have two brothers and one sister.
items.pinyin: wǒ yǒu liǎng gè xiōngdì, yí gè jiěmèi.
items.pronounce: waw yoh lyang guh syong-dee, yee guh jyeh-may.
items.comment: A response indicating the number of siblings.

items.title: How many people are in your family?
How many people are in your family?
items.pinyin: nǐ jiā yǒu jǐ kǒu rén?
items.pronounce: nee jya yo jee koh ren?
items.comment: Used to ask how many people are in someone's family.

items.title: There are five people in my family.
items.pinyin: wǒ jiā yǒu wǔ kǒu rén
items.pronounce: woh jya yo woo koh ren
items.comment: A typical response to the question 'How many people are in your family?'

items.title: How old is Teacher Li?
items.comment: Used to ask about Teacher Li's age.

items.title: He is 50 years old this year.
items.comment: The response to the question, stating Teacher Li's age.

items.title: What about her daughter?
items.comment: Used to ask about someone's daughter after talking about the person.

items.title: Her daughter is 20 years old this year.
items.pinyin: Tā nǚ'ér jīnnián èr shí suì
items.pronounce: Tah nyoo-err jin-nian ur shr sway
items.comment: A response to the question about her daughter’s age.
